item.title: Politics of unequal memory
item.description: HISTORY has a way of returning not as memory, but as message. On December 16, Bangladesh marks Victory Day as the culmination of nine months of armed struggle, mass sacrifice and a brutal war that gave birth to an independent nation. It is the day when the Pakistani military surrendered in Dhaka, sealing Bangladesh’s long-cherished sovereignty. India, which joined......

item.title: Gas, geopolitics, geo-economics and genocidal gain
item.description: FOR all the rhetoric of solidarity and ritualised outrage, the Israeli genocide in Palestine has remained a secondary concern for the regional powers that possessed the diplomatic, economic and strategic leverage to alter the trajectory of Gaza’s devastation. Instead of exercising influence, regional capitals have retreated into calculated restraint. Brittle power......

item.title: Navigating food safety crossroads
item.description: ON A humid afternoon in Dhaka, a hawker slices boiled eggs into a steaming bowl of street biryani while a delivery van backs into a restaurant yard stacked with plastic crates. For millions of Bangladeshis who eat outside the home or buy fresh produce from markets every day, that image is normal — and it captures a simple truth: food is where daily life......

item.title: History, narrative and politics of memory
item.description: HISTORY is a discipline — but we also use the same word to mean the description of past events produced through the methods of that discipline. A historically grounded account rests on evidence, passes through multiple stages of scrutiny and — most importantly — always leaves room for correction. No historical claim is final; it remains open to revision as new evidence emerges or new questions are asked......

item.title: Worrying precedent in deans’ removal in Rajshahi Univ
item.description: THE events that took place in the University of Rajshahi regarding the deans’ removal are concerning. It suggests a troubling breakdown in campus governance. The authorities relieved six deans of their responsibilities amid protests by a section of students and leaders of the Rajshahi University Central Students’ Union. The deans tendered their resignation although there......

item.title: Society must unite against ‘evil forces’ behind mobs
item.description: THE protest, the human chain and the call put forth at a protest in Dhaka on December 22 for unity against ‘evil forces’ behind the mob violence that has created a fearful situation in society are a good step forward.
